message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient's symptoms suggest cirrhosis, and the dilated submucosal veins with red spots suggest esophageal varices. Nadolol therapy is used to prevent the growth of varices and to prevent bleeding from existing varices in patients with cirrhosis. Injection sclerotherapy is used for acute bleeding from varices. Isosorbide mononitrate therapy may improve symptoms of esophageal spasms but is not indicated in this case. Transjugular intrahepatic portosystemic shunt is an option in patients with refractory bleeding from varices but is not indicated in this case as the patient does not have active bleeding.
